Description: Rectangular mudstone cosmetic-palette. One side has slight depression surrounded by crescent-shaped peck marks, while the other side has the stain of red pigment, probably ochre, but no signs of wear.
Curator's comments: Published: G Brunton and G Caton-Thompson, The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (British School of Archaeology in Egypt 46, 1928) , 3, pl. XXI.3 R Friedman 'Badari Grave Group 569' in W. V. Davies (ed), Studies in Egyptian Antiquities: A Tribute to T. G. H. James (BM Occasional Paper 123, 1999), 2, colour pl I. [number misquoted as EA 52726]
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
